Whales, Wedges & Wine: New Amateur Golf Tournament Launched in South Africa
Whales, Wedges & Wine: New Amateur Golf Tournament Launched in South Africa
Giltedge Golf & Safari has joined forces with the Cape’s top ranked golf course and resort, Arabella Hotel & Spa, to create a fun-filled amateur golfing tournament for international golf travellers.
The inaugural Whale Tail Classic will be held from 30 September to 5 October this year and will coincide with the annual whale watching season in Hermanus.
Hermanus, which is a mere 1 hour from Cape Town, has been recognized by the WWF (World Wildlife Fund) as one of the best whale watching destinations in the world. Hermanus, in particular Walker Bay, is the mating and breeding ground of the Southern Right Whale during the winter and spring months (from June to November). Southern Right Whales migrate from the Antarctic around June to calve and mate. Calving takes place in August and September and the males arrive for mating in October when the whale population peaks.
Golfers and non-golfers will have the opportunity to experience the best of the Cape Whale Coast by taking part in the Whale Tail Classic 2015. The tournament package includes 5-nights’ accommodation at the 5-star Arabella Hotel & Spa, 3 competition rounds on two immaculate golf courses (Arabella GC and Hermanus GC), a wine tasting tour through the Hermanus Wine Valley region, a spectacular boat-based whale-watching excursion, all transfers, fabulous functions and of course great prizes and entertainment.
Giltedge Golf & Safari is part of the award-winning group of companies, Giltedge Travel, and is a specialist golf travel business that offers clients the ultimate in luxury travel combined with the opportunity to experience Southern Africa’s internationally accredited Championship golf courses & Big Five Safari Experiences
